result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles C. Stubblefield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and DA service fees.    **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
----------------------------------------

*Comply with terms of civil agreement in Walworth County Case 2015CV450.
----------------------------------------
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
----------------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
----------------------------------------

*Comply with terms of civil agreement in Walworth County Case 2015CV450.  Restitution is set at $86,000.00 plus interest noting that $4,000 has been paid.  Restitution is to be paid pursuant to the terms of the civil agreement and is not to be collected through DOC.  Defendant must, however, provide his Probation Agent with proof of payments.

timeConds.notes:
to commence on or before 01/22/18 at 8:00 a.m. and WITH work release privileges for WORK ONLY. 
*May be served in Walworth County or Waukesha County.

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the appeal is dismissed.  WIS. STAT. RULE 809.83(2)
IT IS ORDERED that the appeal is dismissed. WIS STAT. RULE 809.83(2).

IT IS ORDERED that upon the appellant's failure to file a statement on transcript, the appeal will proceed without the benefit of transcripts not already prepared.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the appellant shall file his appellant's brief no later than October 17, 2018.
Pro se motion denied -Huber
Pro Se Motion sent to Judge for response - Huber

IT IS ORDERED that Stubblefield shall file a statement on transcript or move for an extension supported by good cause on or before September 7, 2018. Stubblefield's failure to act by the extended deadline will require the appeal will proceed without the benefit of transcripts not already filed in the circuit court.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the briefing schedule in this case is stayed until further order of this court.

11:02 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Charles C. Stubblefield in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.
Matter is on for defense' postconviction motions.  
Court has reviewed the written materials filed by both sides as well as other information in the Court file.  
11:03 am  Argument by Atty Simon.  
11:05 am  Argument by Atty Donohoo that no factual record has been made by the defendant.  
11:07 am  Court has reviewed the transcript of the plea hearing and what was on file.  Court makes record based upon review of transcript.  Court finds defendant's rights have not been violated.  Court does not find that the State breached the plea agreement.  Had the Court believed the State was violating the plea agreement at sentencing, the Court would have spoken up.  Court has reviewed the sentencing transcript and the applicable law.  Defense did not object during sentencing or at the end of sentencing to an alleged breach of the plea agreement.  It has to be a substantial and material breach of the plea agreement. Court did not find at the time of sentence or after further review of the file, that the State has substantially and materially this plea agreement.  Court does not find that the State has broken it at all.  Court does not believe State breached the plea agreement.  There was no reason for Atty Bucher to voice an objection therefore he was not ineffective.  
11:22 am  Atty Simon requests one point of clarification.  
11:23 am  Response by Court.  
11:23 am  Response by Atty Donohoo with regard to the letter of Atty Bucher which was copied to Mr. Stubblefield.  
11:24 am  Atty Simon should prepare Order.  Court in recess.
State's Brief in Response to Def's Mt for Postconviction Relief

10:03 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Charles C. Stubblefield in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  
Court makes record as to the charge and penalties.  Matter is on today for a sentencing hearing.  
Court has reviewed documents filed by the defense.  
Defendant's parents are appearing by phone to give a statement to the Court.  
Holli Stubblefield and Charles Stubblefield (parents of defendant) appear by phone.  
10:05 am  Statement by defendant's mother on behalf of her son.  
10:07 am  Statement by defendant's father on behalf of his son.  
10:08 am  Atty Bucher has reviewed the victim impact statement with his client.  
10:09 am  Statement of Atty Peter Ludwig on behalf of victims.  Atty Ludwig reads victim's statement into the record.  
10:17 am  Atty Donohoo first makes record with regard to restitution.  Total agreed restitution is $96,000; $14,000 has been paid leaving a balance of $82,000.  
State is not making any specific recommendation as to sentence as part of the plea agreement.  
10:31 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Bucher.  
10:48 am  Statement by Sarah Stubblefield on behalf of her husband.  
10:51 am  Statement by Pastor Jason Ewart on behalf of deft.  
10:52 am  Further argument by Atty Bucher.  10:55 am  Statement by defendant.  
10:59 am  Response by defendant to Court's questions.  
11:01 am  Court takes recess to review everything that was e-filed.  

11:16 am  Court in session.  ADA Leusink now appears on behalf of the State.  
Court has had a chance to review the letters that were submitted. 
Court makes record and sentences the defendant as follows:  

SENTENCE WITHHELD:  5 years probation;  **Court initially ordered 7 years probation but then determined maximum term would be 5 years;  
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
1)  Serve One (1) year in Jail with work release for WORK only.  May be served in Walworth County or Waukesha County.  Jail time to begin on January 22, 2018.  
2)  Comply with terms of civil agreement in Walworth County Case 15CV450.  Restitution is set at $86,000.00 plus interest noting that $4,000 has been paid.  Restitution is to be paid pursuant to the terms of the civil agreement and is not to be collected through DOC.  Defendant must, however, provide his Probation Agent with proof of payments.  
3)  Pay court costs.  
4)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
5)  No weapons.  
6)  Undergo any counseling or evaluations recommended by Agent.  
7)  Maintain full time employment.  
8)  No contact with the Sarna's.  
11:41 am  Court in recess.

2:30 pm FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  
ADA Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Charles C. Stubblefield in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  
This case is currently scheduled for Jury Trial next week.  Atty Bucher has filed a Motion to adjourn the trial.  Atty Bucher argues that there is an outstanding Motion before Judge Reddy to compel discovery which was never addressed.  He indicates that the government did respond to his discovery demand but said it did not have that discovery.  Atty Bucher states there are approximately 600 pages of discovery that he received on February 27th and he has only gotten through about 1/3 of it.  Attorney Donohoo argues that the State is not going to incur any time or expense to get records that are not in its custody and control and that the State does not intend to use at trial.  Anything in the State's custody and control has been given to the defense.  Victims are present in court.  Attorney Bucher makes record with regard to a civil action that had been filed.  The defendant is willing to waive his right to a jury trial and have a court trial.  The State is also willing to waive jury trial.  This is a legal issue and not a factual issue.  Court has colloquy with the defendant with regard to waiver of jury trial.  Court finds defendant's waiver to be free and voluntary and will schedule the matter for a court trial.  Court trial scheduled for June 26, 2017 at 08:30 am (3 days).
Letter to Court re: State's Response to Motion for Adjournment

Transcript of Final Pretrial Hearing before the Hon. David M. Reddy on April 27, 2016
Court Reporter:  Eileen Walsh Grzenia

3:26 p.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Charles C. Stubblefield in court with attorney Daniel H Sanders.  
Court has concerns about the Motion to Withdraw that has been filed.  This is the 2nd time that a Motion to Withdraw has been filed just prior to trial.  Court's concern is that this is being done for delay.  
Response by Attorney Sanders. 
Court makes further record as to what the file shows with regard to Atty Lettenberger's reasons for withdrawal.  At Court's request, Atty Sanders makes further record as to reasons for his Motion to Withdraw.  Court asks who is at fault for this breakdown?  
Response by Atty Sanders as to requests for his client to provide documents.  But for his breakdown in the relationship, he believes he would be prepared to go to trial if his client had come through with providing the documentation.  
Response by Atty Donohoo.  
Court is giving the Defendant the opportunity to respond but also advises him that anything he says will be on the record. 
3:41 pm  Statement by Mr. Stubblefield.  
3:43 pm  Response by Attorney Sanders.  
3:44 pm  Response by Attorney Donohoo.  Atty Donohoo would have no objection to the Court meeting in chambers with Atty Sanders and the Defendant.  
3:46 pm  Court makes further record as to circumstances under which Mr. Stubblefield can lose his right to counsel.  
3:47 pm  Court has colloquy with the Defendant.  Court is very much concerned that this is being done for delay.  
3:49 pm  Atty Sanders makes further record.  
3:49 pm  Court is going to pass this matter now and determine what is going on with the other trials set on today's final pre-trial calendar.    

4:31 pm  Case recalled.  
4:31 pm  Atty Sanders makes further record that he believes he truly cannot effectively represent Mr. Stubblefield in a trial.  
Court addresses Mr. Stubblefield.  Mr. Stubblefield indicates he has already contacted 2 other criminal defense attorneys.  Defendant indicates that Attorney Paul Bucher has indicated he will represent him.  Atty Donohoo notes that the Defendant referenced Atty Bucher the last time there was a Motion to Withdraw as Counsel filed by Attorney Lettenberger.  
Court makes record and will set this matter on for a status in a week or two.  Court will not grant Atty Sanders' request to withdraw until another Attorney is on board.  
Court will set this matter for status with the understanding that both Attorney Sanders and Attorney Bucher will be present.  
4:38 pm  Court in recess.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH B.S. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
